channel.title: CVE Feed for CHANGING Information Technology -- TCBServiSign Windows Version
channel.description: The latest CVEs for CHANGING Information Technology -- TCBServiSign Windows Version

item.title: CVE-2024-40720|2024-08-02T16:08:16.108Z -- changing%20information%20technology -- tcbservisign%20windows%20version
item.description: The specific API in TCBServiSign Windows Version from CHANGING Information Technology does not properly validate server-side input. When a user visits a spoofed website, unauthenticated remote attackers can modify the `HKEY_CURRENT_USER` registry to execute arbitrary commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-40722|2024-08-02T14:02:50.759Z -- changing%20information%20technology -- tcbservisign%20windows%20version
item.description: The specific API in TCBServiSign Windows Version from CHANGING Information Technology does does not properly validate the length of server-side input. When a user visits a spoofed website, unauthenticated remote attackers can cause a stack-based buffer overflow in the TCBServiSign, temporarily disrupting its service.

item.title: CVE-2024-40719|2024-08-02T10:05:24.168Z -- changing%20information%20technology -- tcbservisign%20windows%20version
item.description: The encryption strength of the authorization keys in CHANGING Information Technology TCBServiSign Windows Version is insufficient. When a remote attacker tricks a victim into visiting a malicious website, TCBServiSign will treat that website as a legitimate server and interact with it.

item.title: CVE-2024-40722|2024-08-02T10:18:36.629Z -- changing%20information%20technology -- tcbservisign%20windows%20version
item.description: The specific API in TCBServiSign Windows Version from CHANGING Information Technology does does not properly validate the length of server-side input. When a user visits a spoofed website, unauthenticated remote attackers can cause a stack-based buffer overflow in the TCBServiSign, temporarily disrupting its service.

item.title: CVE-2024-40721|2024-08-02T10:14:39.889Z -- changing%20information%20technology -- tcbservisign%20windows%20version
item.description: The specific API in TCBServiSign Windows Version from CHANGING Information Technology does not properly validate server-side input. When a user visits a spoofed website, unauthenticated remote attackers can cause the TCBServiSign to load a DLL from an arbitrary path.

item.description: The specific API in TCBServiSign Windows Version from CHANGING Information Technology does not properly validate server-side input. When a user visits a spoofed website, unauthenticated remote attackers can modify the `HKEY_CURRENT_USER` registry to execute arbitrary commands.

item.description: The specific API in TCBServiSign Windows Version from CHANGING Information Technology does not properly validate server-side input. When a user visits a spoofed website, unauthenticated remote attackers can cause the TCBServiSign to load a DLL from an arbitrary path.

item.title: CVE-2024-40719|2024-08-02T15:30:54.622Z -- changing%20information%20technology -- tcbservisign%20windows%20version
item.description: The encryption strength of the authorization keys in CHANGING Information Technology TCBServiSign Windows Version is insufficient. When a remote attacker tricks a victim into visiting a malicious website, TCBServiSign will treat that website as a legitimate server and interact with it.
